definitions.definition: To raise the back of the tongue toward the velum while articulating another consonant, such as the l of English pool .
To replace a (usually more front) consonant with a velar .
examples: In several dialects of Central German, the cluster -nd- has been velarized to -ng-.

main_definition: ( phonology ) To raise the back of the tongue toward the velum while articulating another consonant, such as the l of English pool .
secondary_definitions: ( phonology ) To replace a (usually more front) consonant with a velar .
